summary: The 'Woke Endowment Security Tax Act of 2025' (WEST Act of 2025) proposes to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. It introduces a 6% excise tax on the large endowments of certain private colleges and universities. The tax applies to institutions with assets exceeding specific thresholds ($11.9 billion for some, $10.5 billion for others operating on behalf of states) at the end of the preceding taxable year. The bill also includes clerical amendments related to the new tax and specifies that it applies to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2024.
